thread.title: People Are Sharing Fake Pictures Of Bikers For Trump Heading To The Inauguration - BuzzFeed News
thread.title_full: People Are Sharing Fake Pictures Of Bikers For Trump Heading To The Inauguration - BuzzFeed News

author: Tasneem Nashrulla
title: People Are Sharing Fake Pictures Of Bikers For Trump Heading To The Inauguration - BuzzFeed News
text:
Cox said that he requested a permit from the National Parks Service for 5,000 bikers to gather at John Marshall Park on Jan. 20, Inauguration Day. The request was approved but the permit was still being processed and had not yet been issued, Mike Litterst, the spokesperson for the National Park Service, told BuzzFeed News on Tuesday. “We process requests in the order in which they were received, first come, first serve,” Litterst said, adding that permits were approved for both pro-Trump and anti-Trump demonstrators.
Cox’s listed purpose for the permit is “to celebrate president elect, and encourage peaceful transition,” according to the list of permit applications for the inauguration provided to BuzzFeed News.
So far, only one permit for an explicitly pro-Trump group — Let America Hear Us, Roar for Trump! — has been issued for 20 people. Another pro-Trump permit requested by Travis Thompson Biker for 5,000 people to support Trump on Jan. 20 is currently being processed.
A permit for the most number of demonstrators so far — 50,000 — was issued for the American Constitution Society, a progressive organization.
ID: 10337106 3. “We have guys coming in right now driving across Texas, Arizona… Guys left San Diego two days ago, large groups coming in from Florida… Pennsylvania has busloads coming in, Ohio, New York — you name it, we got bikers coming in to town,” Cox told Fox & Friends on Saturday. View this image ›
insider.foxnews.com ID: 10337645 4. However, several pro-Trump accounts on social media are using pictures and videos that falsely claim to show large groups of bikers on their way to the inauguration in Washington. View this image ›
Twitter: @LindaLeeJones11 ID: 10337723 5. This photo shared by several Trump supporters, including a popular Daily Mail columnist, that claimed to show Bikers for Trump headed to Washington for the inauguration has been circulating since 2013. View this image ›
Twitter: @KTHopkins ID: 10337873 6. The photo appeared in a 2013 Spanish blog post about bikers and also in a 2013 thread on a Czech bike forum. View this image ›
blogs.hoy.es ID: 10337885 7. And a YouTube video titled Bikers for Trump DC Bound 2017 — which has more than 50,000 views so far — appears to be a video of a bike run for the Marine Toys for Tots program in Louisville, Kentucky. BIKERS FOR TRUMP DC BOUND 2017 https://t.co/zkxVSdkOo3 via @YouTube
— Mike C Borlovan (@1baldeagle77) The location and the stores visible in the video appear to correspond to a Google Maps location on Old Preston Highway North in Louisville, which held a Toys for Tots bike run on Nov. 27, 2016.
ID: 10338076 8. This screenshot from the video appears to show a man in military uniform collecting toys and games from the bikers. View this image ›
youtube.com ID: 10338318 9. And a billboard visible in the video urges people to vote on Nov. 8 and also appeals to people to vote for Dan Johnson, the Republican state representative for the 49th district of Kentucky. Johnson won the District State House race on Dec. 13, 2016. View this image ›
youtube.com ID: 10338391 10. Pro-Trump accounts talking about Bikers for Trump at the inauguration are using this photo of bikers that has been circulating on pro-Trump sites since April 2016. imgur.com
Twitter: @CarolineWalkerB
 The photo has been used in pro-Trump articles to show Bikers for Trump at different Trump rallies in 2016 as well as to show the bikers going to Cleveland for the Republican National Convention.
ID: 10338559 11. Another photo claiming to show “Bikers for Trump in Florida heading out to Washington DC for the inauguration” has appeared on pro-Trump social media accounts frequently, dating back to last May when it claimed to show “100,000 bikers at a Trump rally.” In 2013, the photo appeared to depict the 2 Million Bikers to DC event on the 12th anniversary of 9/11. View this image ›
Twitter: @mhoward48 ID: 10338628 12. Another pro-Trump biker group, Bikers 4 Liberty, which has been tweeting alleged videos and pictures of bikers heading to the inauguration, was labeled a “scam group” by Cox. A Large group of Sport Bikes is heading to the @TrumpInaugural right now! Join https://t.co/3KCZtIYPU9 whether you… https://t.co/sIKVy1mNTV
— Bikers 4 Liberty (@Bikers4Liberty) According to a video Cox shared with his followers, Bikers 4 Liberty — which earlier went by Bikers 4 Trump — was a “scam run by a serial con man” who “defrauded thousands of Trump supporters and conducted illegal fundraisers.”
Cox did not respond to BuzzFeed News’ request for comment.
ID: 10339081 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
Tasneem Nashrulla is a reporter for BuzzFeed News and is based in New York. Contact Tasneem Nashrulla at tasneem.nashrulla@buzzfeed.com . Got a confidential tip? Submit it here .
